content:
Here is a calendar format to help you keep track of the productions you've seen:

**March 2023**

* 25th: "Rent" at City Theater

**April 2023**

* 2nd: "The Storyteller" at Fringe Theater
* 10th: Dress Rehearsal for [Play Title] (stagehand)
* 17th: Opening Night of [Play Title]
* 22nd: "The Importance of Being Earnest" at University Theater

I've left a blank for the title of the play you worked on as a stagehand, as you didn't mention the title. Feel free to fill it in if you'd like!

If you'd like, I can also suggest some ways to keep track of your theater-going adventures going forward. Here are a few ideas:

* Create a spreadsheet or document to log your theater experiences, including the date, title, theater, and any notes or reviews you'd like to write.
* Use a habit-tracking app or digital calendar to mark the dates you attend productions and add notes or reminders as needed.
* Take photos of your ticket stubs or programs and create a physical or digital scrapbook to commemorate your theater experiences.
* Write a brief review or reflection on each production and collect them in a journal or blog.

Let me know if any of these ideas appeal to you, or if you have any other questions or requests!
